purpleculture_pinyin:
kuī
deficiency; deficit; luckily; it's lucky that...; (often ironically) fancy that...
дефицит; дефицит; к счастью; повезло, что ...; (часто по иронии судьбы) вообразите, что ...
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 亏)
Synonym: 缺 損
Antonyms: 盈 滿
Ideographic: A tiger 虍 mauling a bird 隹; 亏 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples: 虧損 [ kuī sǔn ]: deficit; (financial) loss
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 雐 [ hū ] a kind of bird
    • 亏 [ kuī ] to lose, to fail; loss, damages; deficient
heisig_chinese_memo: You can't afford to have another turkey loss to the tiger, so you set all sorts of traps for the tiger.  What will you use those snake hooks for?
Ru_trainchinese: kuī: (глаг) нести убытки; не хватать, недоставать; к счастью, удачно, что...; обижать; (используется, чтобы выразить иронию)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the loss (亏) of the tiger (虍) and the little bird (隹) means you are lacking
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When you catch an (one) animal in your snare it's a loss of life but allow your to live.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " loss " to "雐" sound, it means loss, reduction. "Shuowen": "Aspiration is also lost. From the loss, the sound. 𧇾, the loss or from the Xi." "Yi‧ Qian": "The way of heaven loses profit and gains modest." Kong Yingdashu: "Loss is a reduction in loss. Reduction in fullness And gain humility."

" Loss " can mean lack or deficiency. "Shu‧Lv Mastiff": "For the mountain nine ren, the work falls short."

" Loss " also means destruction and injury. "Poetry·Lu Song·Yugong": "No loss, no collapse, no shock or no rise." Zheng Xuanjian: "Loss and collapse are both destruction."

" Loss " also means loss. "Warring States Policy‧Wei Ceyi": "The husband Qin must cut off the land and the quality, so the soldiers are not used and the country is in deficit."

" Loss " also means violation. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Chajin": "At that time, it was already at a loss with the law of the first king."

" Losing " also means being sorry and disappointing. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Wang Yun Biography": "Yun was ordered by special election to punish Ni Fushun. It was not a month before, and the state was clarified. If you want to list his honors, please give him a reward. If he serves improperly, he should be blamed. The punishment is light and heavy, and there is a loss of hope."

" Loss " in modern Chinese is a shorthand for "lucky" and "lucky", which means luck. Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Jade Mirror Terrace" has the 4th percentile: "Bachelor, thanks to you." It can also express sarcasm, " "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 20: "You are still a master at a loss, and you just lost one or two hundred dollars!"

" Loss " also refers to a deficit. "Qing Barnyard Banknotes‧Diet": "If you live in nothing, thank you for losing money." The idiom "self-financing" also uses this meaning.
humanum_short_description_en: From " loss ", the sound of "雐" means loss or reduction.
humanum_full_description:
從「亏」，「雐」聲，表示減損、減少。《說文》：「气損也。从亏，雐聲。𧇾，虧或从兮。」《易‧謙》：「天道虧盈而益謙。」孔穎達疏：「虧謂減損。減損盈滿而增益謙退。」

　　「虧」可表示欠缺、不足。《書‧旅獒》：「為山九仞，功虧一簣。」

　　「虧」也表示毀壞、損傷。《詩‧魯頌‧閟宮》：「不虧不崩，不震不騰。」鄭玄箋：「虧、崩皆謂毀壞也。」

　　「虧」還表示損失。《戰國策‧魏策一》：「夫事秦必割地效質，故兵未用而國已虧矣。」

　　「虧」亦表示違背。《呂氏春秋‧察今》：「其時已與先王之法虧矣。」

　　「虧」也表示對不住、辜負。《後漢書‧王允傳》：「允以特選受命，誅逆撫順，曾未期月，州境澄清。方欲列其庸勳，請加爵賞，而以奉事不當，當肆大戮。責輕罰重，有虧眾望。」

　　「虧」在近現代漢語中是「幸虧」、「虧得」的簡省語，表示僥倖，元關漢卿《玉鏡臺》第4摺：「學士，這多虧了你也。」也可表示譏諷，《紅樓夢》第20回：「虧你還是個爺，輸了一二百錢就這麼着！」

　　「虧」還指虧空。《清稗類鈔‧飲食類》：「居無何，謝以虧帑黜。」成語「自負盈虧」亦用此義。
humanum_short_description: 從「亏」，「雐」聲，表示減損、減少。

從「 亏 」，「 雐 」聲，表示減損、減少。《說文》：「气損也。从亏，雐聲。𧇾，虧或从兮。」《易‧謙》：「天道虧盈而益謙。」孔穎達疏：「虧謂減損。減損盈滿而增益謙退。」 「 虧 」可表示欠缺、不足。《書‧旅獒》：「為山九仞，功虧一簣。」 「 虧 」也表示毀壞、損傷。《詩‧魯頌‧閟宮》：「不虧不崩，不震不騰。」鄭玄箋：「虧、崩皆謂毀壞也。」 「 虧 」還表示損失。《戰國策‧魏策一》：「夫事秦必割地效質，故兵未用而國已虧矣。」 「 虧 」亦表示違背。《呂氏春秋‧察今》：「其時已與先王之法虧矣。」 「 虧 」也表示對不住、辜負。《後漢書‧王允傳》：「允以特選受命，誅逆撫順，曾未期月，州境澄清。方欲列其庸勳，請加爵賞，而以奉事不當，當肆大戮。責輕罰重，有虧眾望。」 「 虧 」在近現代漢語中是「幸虧」、「虧得」的簡省語，表示僥倖，元關漢卿《玉鏡臺》第4摺：「學士，這多虧了你也。」也可表示譏諷，《紅樓夢》第20回：「虧你還是個爺，輸了一二百錢就這麼着！」 「 虧 」還指虧空。《清稗類鈔‧飲食類》：「居無何，謝以虧帑黜。」成語「自負盈虧」亦用此義。
From " loss" to " 雐" sound, it means loss, reduction. "Shuowen": "Aspiration is also lost. From the loss, the sound. 𧇾, the loss or from the Xi." "Yi‧ Qian": "The way of heaven loses profit and gains modest." Kong Yingdashu: "Loss is a reduction in loss. Reduction in fullness And gain humility." " Loss" can mean lack or deficiency. "Shu‧Lv Mastiff": "For the mountain nine ren, the work falls short." " Loss" also means destruction and injury. "Poetry·Lu Song·Yugong": "No loss, no collapse, no shock or no rise." Zheng Xuanjian: "Loss and collapse are both destruction." " Loss" also means loss. "Warring States Policy‧Wei Ceyi": "The husband Qin must cut off the land and the quality, so the soldiers are not used and the country is in deficit." " Loss" also means violation. "Lu Shichunqiu‧ Chajin": "At that time, it was already at a loss with the law of the first king." " Losing" also means being sorry and disappointing. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Wang Yun Biography": "Yun was ordered by special election to punish Ni Fushun. It was not a month before, and the state was clarified. If you want to list his honors, please give him a reward. If he serves improperly, he should be blamed. The punishment is light and heavy, and there is a loss of hope." " Loss" in modern Chinese is a shorthand for "lucky" and "lucky", which means luck. Yuan Guan Hanqing's "Jade Mirror Terrace" has the 4th percentile: "Bachelor, thanks to you." It can also express sarcasm, " "Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 20: "You are still a master at a loss, and you just lost one or two hundred dollars!" " Loss" also refers to a deficit. "Qing Barnyard Banknotes‧Diet": "If you live in nothing, thank you for losing money." The idiom "self-financing" also uses this meaning.

虧字的基本解释

虧
kuī
见“亏”。

虧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kuī］
［《廣韻》去爲切，平支，溪。］
“亏1”的繁体字。
(1)气不足，气虚。
(2)减损；减少。
(3)欠缺；不足。
(4)毁坏；损伤。
(5)损失。
(6)违背。
(7)亏空；蚀本。
(8)心虚；胆怯。
(9)虚弱。
(10)辜负；亏待。
(11)歇；消失。
(12)表示侥幸之词。犹幸亏，多亏。
(13)幸亏、亏得的反说，表示讥讽。

虧字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虍字部】　虧； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1075第42
【唐韻】去爲切【集韻】【韻會】驅爲切，?音?。【說文】氣損也。【徐曰】气闕，則其出舒遲，故字从亐。【廣韻】缺也。【史記·蔡澤傳】月滿則虧。【晉書·律歷志】月在外道，先交後會者，虧蝕西南角起。　又與羲通。【六書正譌】伏羲，古作虙虧。

虧字的源字形

字源演变：

楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
虧字的起名意思

暂无。

Basic explanation of words
deficit
kuī
See "Loss".
deficit
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [kuī]
["Guangyun" goes to cut, flat branch, stream. ]
Traditional characters for "Loss 1".
(1) Insufficient qi, deficiency of qi.
(2) Decrease; decrease.
(3) Lack; insufficient.
(4) Destroy; damage.
(5) Loss.
(6) Violation.
(7) Deficit; loss of capital.
(8) A guilty conscience; timidity.
(9) Weakness.
(10) Betrayal; treat badly.
(11) Rest; disappear.
(12) A word that means luck. Fortunately, thanks.
(13) Fortunately, retort, expressing sarcasm.
deficit
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shen Ji] [Feng Zi Department] 　 Lose; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1075 Page 42
[Tang Yun] Go to cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Drive to cut, "Yin". [Said the text] gas loss also. [Xu Yue] Deficiency of qi means Shu Chi, so the word is from Qi. [Guang Yun] Missing too. 【Historical Records·Cai Ze Chuan】Loss at full moon. [Jin Shu·Lv Li Zhi] The month is outside the road, and those who meet first and meet later will lose money from the southwest corner.　 And Xi Tong again. 【Six Books Zhengji】Fuxi, the ancient masterpiece.
